messages.message:
Hey team, Happy New Year!

A couple of questions related to the GPT-4 usage policy change, with the context that we’re planning for an enterprise customer who is starting to take ownership of a production solution that is using LLMs through Refiner:
• Are there plans for `ib_llm_tools` or similar to programmatically block/prevent/obfuscate users from opting into GPT-4? I know it is opt in at the moment already, but wondered if we are planning for any additional guardrails
• Is there anything we can do to monitor GPT-4 usage? For example, any Grafana dashboards/alerting that are set up to pick up when GPT-4 has been specified so that we can take action?
I suggest that we rebuild ib_llm_tools with the advanced=true option removed.

It seems like the ideal approach would be to never hand over our license to customers or give them free reign to an env that has it installed.

And if there are any scenarios where we would need to use our own license (as opposed to theirs), then we should have a separate license that we can install which automatically only allows usage within our policy (eg. can't access GPT-4).
